name: Pad Thai in Sweet Sauce
ingredientLines: Recipe Pad Thai in Sweet Sauce No one who has ever visited Thailand doesn’t miss Pad Thai. You know what? Even if you haven’t been to Thailand in your life, after the first bite you will be transported there. Albeit for only a few minutes but that’s still something! Times Prep Time : 15 min Cook Time : 25 min Ready Time : 40 min Servings 4 Ingredients 1 Pounds (1/2 kilo) chicken breast cut into strips 5 tablespoons soybean oil 1/4 white cabbage, shredded 1 large carrot, peeled and julienned 1/2 tsp fresh ginger, grated 3 eggs 1 package rice noodles, soaked in cold water (for 3 hours prior to prep) 1/2 cup tofu, cubed 1/3 cup light soy sauce 5-6 Tbsp palm sugar or white sugar 2 full handfuls of bean sprouts 4 scallions (green part only), cut into 2” pieces 4 Tbsp roasted peanuts, chopped Handful cilantro leaves, separated from the stems 4 tablespoons lemon juice 10 tablespoons fish sauce* Directions Fill a wok with 3 cups water and bring to a boil.  Blanch the chicken for 2 minutes until it becomes white on the outside.  Drain chicken and set aside. Heat the oil in the wok and add the cabbage and the carrots.  Saute for a minute and add the ginger.  Break the eggs into the wok and scramble them.  Add the noodles and stir until some of the noodles soften (about 3 minutes).  Next add the tofu, blanched chicken, soy sauce, sugar, lemon juice and fish sauce and continue to stir about 3 minutes until everything is well mixed and the noodles are all cooked through. Add the sprouts and scallions and mix for 30 seconds.  Serve in a deep dish and top with cilantro and peanuts. * For kosher reasons use this Vegan Fish Sauce Recipe Similar Recipes Salty Sweet SundaeMango Peanut CrispSweet and Sour Asian Noodles
